group_1.textLeft: I think I figured out the theme that our movie@needs...

group_1.textRight: What is it...?

group_1.textLeft: Youth!

group_1.textRight: Youthâ€¦?
...Excuse me?

group_1.textLeft: Just listen to me for a sec.
We want to make a movie for Tomo-C's@competition,
And decided we'd make a drama for it, right?

group_1.textRight: Yes, so we can get a high rating and win a prize@of our choice.
To do that, we need to be original and stand@out from the other films.

group_1.textLeft: Mm-hmm. As part of that, we were trying to find@the proper setting,
And along the way, we came up with ideas for@the story.

group_1.textRight: From my understanding, the broad outline of our@idea...
Is that the protagonists come to the beach to@find the truth about the mermaid legend.
They encounter a mysterious enemy who forces@them to retreat to the beach house,
And there, they uncover clues that lead them@to the truth.
That alone would be a compelling story, but...
Rena, you realized there was something missing,@right?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah.
I liked the idea that Kasane came up with about@the relationship element.

group_1.textRight: You mean the one where all the main characters@start off as friends, but ultimately split up?

group_1.textLeft: Right.
But I realized that'd be impossible to pull off@since we can't get along to begin with.
I know it's a movie, but I can't fake something@like that for one second!

group_1.textRight: But what if we didn't have to fake it at all?

group_1.textLeft: How so?

group_1.textRight: You and I aren't anywhere close to being friends,

group_1.textLeft: But we've been able to work together for the@movie and the volleyball game.
Little by little, we've been able to see eye to eye...
When you look at it like that...doesn't it sound@a lot like a teen movie?
I see...if we switch gears and tell a story like that,@we won't have to pretend after all.
Our actions and thoughts have been naturally@slotting into a "teen movie" framework.

group_1.textRight: And if we just act like the way we are in real life,@it's easier to film.

group_1.textLeft: I don't care about understanding each other or@any of that nonsense.
As long as I don't have to lie and pretend we're@friends, I'm all for it.

group_1.textRight: Oh? But didn't you compliment Minami's skills@just a moment ago?

group_1.textLeft: Th-that was just... heat of the moment, that's all!

group_1.textRight: *Giggle*
Maybe we can get along even better once we@start filming...?

group_1.textLeft: N-no! We won't!
That's right! Don't get any stupid ideas!

group_1.textRight: Huh?!

group_1.textLeft: Looks like it's all starting to come together.@We've got a theme and a location...
But don't we need to decide on the climax?

group_1.textRight: Mm... I guess you're right.
If we're going with a drama...
Then perhaps the heroes participate in a@tournament,
And overcome the strongest and most vicious@of enemies!

group_1.textLeft: You read way too many shonens, Hikaru.

group_1.textRight: And you play way too many video games.

group_1.textLeft: That's none of your business!
In any case, I get what you're saying.
I think a fitting climax would be the main@characters working together...
To overcome a huge challenge.

group_1.textRight: Yeah!

group_1.textLeft: But now we need to figure out what that could be...

group_1.textRight: I have an idea, actually.
Shall I present it?
